classes.name: tabs__header--sticky
classes.description:
Makes the header sticky.
The top position can be set with the `--eds-tabs-sticky-header-top-position` at any time.
Allowing it to behave well in any circumstances, even when there is margin/padding preventing it to reach top

classes.name: tabs--classic
classes.description: Modified to change to a classic theme

classes.name: tabs__list-wrap
classes.description: A wrapping element around tab list

classes.name: tabs__list-wrap--solid-background
classes.description:
The modern mode's header usually being transparent, this adds a solid background when sticky to avoid text overflowing the header when scrolling.
This can be updated in the consumer's css code to suit his needs in case he's not using the default background color

classes.name: tabs__list
classes.description: A list element containing tab items

classes.name: tabs--overflow-menu
classes.description: A wrapping class when you're using an overflow menu

classes.name: tabs--vertical
classes.description: Modified to change to vertical tabs

classes.name: tabs__close
classes.description: Styles for the tab close button

description:
The **tabs** component represents a fixed navigation element used
to organize the content of an individual layout container. Clicking on each
tab will display a specific content view associated with that tab. These are
not top-level navigation elements. They are used to navigate between separate
labeled sections of an application orsub-elements that contain related
information. For example, patient demographics, patient family history, and
patient medications related to one patient could be in separate views
separated by tabs.
name: Tabs
usage:
```html
Content 1
Content 2
Content 3
```
